column4: It seems that xdm is not accessing the /etc/X11/xdm directory config files at all.  It is starting or at least trying to start but the echo statments I put into the config files are never getting accessed.  Anyone with any ideas on where to start troubleshooting?
nothing that gives indication of problem that i can find.
np
do you mean xdm starts and awaits user input, or do you mean it starts but seems to exit?
starts but runs in background.  never gives login and just drops back to text environment.  ps -ef shows process still running but nothing else.
if I set default to gdm, works fine.  only when set to xdm does it do this.
sounds like a missing lib. What do the log files tell you?
any pointer on which log file I should focus on?
auth.log?
daemon.log?
neither of those logs show anything that would indicate a problem to me.
did you try dpkg-reconfigure xdm ?
yes.
any other ideas?
or any idea of who might have the knowledge needed?
not off the top of my head. You could ask daniels, but he might be busy.
k. thx.
daniels or danielg?
dont see a daniels on here.
so he's asleep/busy atm
k. thx.
